import numpy as np
import pandas as pd


import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
%matplotlib inline
import seaborn as sns

import plotly.express as px
import plotly.graph_objects as go
import plotly.io as pio

import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")
source.91c68aef:
train_df = pd.read_csv('../input/titanic/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('../input/titanic/test.csv')

#printing train and test columns
train_cols = train_df.columns.to_list()
test_cols = test_df.columns.to_list()

print("Training Columns :", train_cols)
print("Testing Columns :", test_cols)
source.4fafac7d:
plt.figure(figsize = (10, 5))

plt.subplot(1, 2, 1)
sns.countplot('Pclass', data = train_df, hue = "Survived")

plt.subplot(1, 2, 2)
sns.barplot(x="Pclass", y="Survived", data=train_df)
plt.show()
source.74610e79:
pcls_1 = train_df.loc[train_df.Pclass == 1]["Survived"]
pcls_1 = sum(pcls_1)/len(pcls_1)

pcls_2 = train_df.loc[train_df.Pclass == 2]["Survived"]
pcls_2 = sum(pcls_2)/len(pcls_2)

pcls_3 = train_df.loc[train_df.Pclass == 3]["Survived"]
pcls_3 = sum(pcls_3)/len(pcls_3)

print("%Pclass 1 who survived:", pcls_1)
print("%Pclass 2 who survived:", pcls_2)
print("%Pclass 3 who survived:", pcls_3)

source.54f1fdf2:
male = train_df.loc[train_df.Sex == "male"]["Survived"]
male = sum(male)/len(male)

female = train_df.loc[train_df.Sex == "female"]["Survived"]
female = sum(female)/len(female)

print("% men who survived:", male)
print("% women who survived:", female)

source.99021e9e:
scls = train_df.loc[train_df.Embarked == "S"]["Survived"]
scls = sum(scls)/len(scls)

ccls = train_df.loc[train_df.Embarked == "C"]["Survived"]
ccls = sum(ccls)/len(ccls)

qcls = train_df.loc[train_df.Embarked == "Q"]["Survived"]
qcls = sum(qcls)/len(qcls)


print("% in Class S who survived:", scls)
print("% in Class C who survived:", ccls)
print("% in Class Q who survived:", qcls)

1. **Numerical Features** :    Age, Fare, SibSp, Parch
2. **Categorical Features** :  Sex, Ticket, Pclass, Survived
3. **AlphaNumeric features** : Cabin, Embarked
